Kural_Info.Tamil_Text: பொருட்பொருளார் புன்னலந் தோயார் அருட்பொருள் ஆயும் அறிவி னவர்.
Kural_Info.English_Meaning: The wise who seek the wealth of grace will not desire the base favours of those who regard wealth (and not pleasure) as (their) riches.

Layered_Composition.Foreground: A wise person is shown on a path. Their goal is a beautiful, celestial city in the distance, representing the 'wealth of Grace' ('அருட்பொருள்').
Layered_Composition.Midground: Along the path, they are tempted by a courtesan ('பொருட்பொருளார்'), whose only goal is material wealth. Her 'base favors' ('புன்னலம்') are shown as a dirty, muddy pool by the side of the road.
Layered_Composition.Background: The wise person, whose gaze is fixed on the higher goal of Grace, completely ignores and walks past the muddy pool of base pleasure, refusing to touch it ('தோயார்').

Art_Direction.Subject_and_Action: Those whose wisdom seeks the higher wealth of Grace will not stoop to touch the base pleasures offered by those who value only material wealth.
Art_Direction.Symbolic_Motifs: The celestial city of Grace vs. the muddy pool of base pleasure is the central contrast. The wise person's unwavering gaze on the higher goal shows their discerning choice.
Art_Direction.Lighting_and_Color: The city of Grace is brilliantly lit with a divine, golden light. The muddy pool is dark, stagnant, and uninviting. The wise person walks in the light of their higher goal.

Technical_Cues.Camera: A shot from behind the wise person, showing their perspective as they ignore the lower temptation and focus on the higher goal.
Technical_Cues.Resolution: 8K, with a beautiful, idealized vision of the city of Grace.
Technical_Cues.Lighting: Symbolic lighting that contrasts the two goals.
